verbs.description: underdraw (third-person singular simple present underdraws, present participle underdrawing, simple past underdrew, past participle underdrawn)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To cover or line the underside of (a floor or roof) with plasterwork, boarding or other such treatment.
examples: The latter had never been underdrawn: its entire anatomy lay bare to an enquiring eye, except where a frame of wood laden with oatcakes and clusters of legs of beef, mutton, and ham, concealed it.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To represent inadequately in an artistic depiction, or in words.
